class.name: Phaser.Tilemap

parameters.name: game
parameters.help: Game reference to the currently running game.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The key of the tilemap data as stored in the Cache. If you're creating a blank map either leave this parameter out or pass `null`.

parameters.name: tileWidth
parameters.help: The pixel width of a single map tile. If using CSV data you must specify this. Not required if using Tiled map data.

parameters.name: tileHeight
parameters.help: The pixel height of a single map tile. If using CSV data you must specify this. Not required if using Tiled map data.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width of the map in tiles. If this map is created from Tiled or CSV data you don't need to specify this.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height of the map in tiles. If this map is created from Tiled or CSV data you don't need to specify this.

class.help:
Creates a new Phaser.Tilemap object. The map can either be populated with data from a Tiled JSON file or from a CSV file.
To do this pass the Cache key as the first parameter. When using Tiled data you need only provide the key.
When using CSV data you must provide the key and the tileWidth and tileHeight parameters.
If creating a blank tilemap to be populated later, you can either specify no parameters at all and then use `Tilemap.create` or pass the map and tile dimensions here.
Note that all Tilemaps use a base tile size to calculate dimensions from, but that a TilemapLayer may have its own unique tile size that overrides it.
A Tile map is rendered to the display using a TilemapLayer. It is not added to the display list directly itself.
A map may have multiple layers. You can perform operations on the map data such as copying, pasting, filling and shuffling the tiles around.

public.name: addTilesetImage

returns.help: Returns the Tileset object that was created or updated, or null if it failed.

public.help: Adds an image to the map to be used as a tileset. A single map may use multiple tilesets.\nNote that the tileset name can be found in the JSON file exported from Tiled, or in the Tiled editor.

parameters.name: tileset
parameters.help: The name of the tileset as specified in the map data.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The key of the Phaser.Cache image used for this tileset. If not specified it will look for an image with a key matching the tileset parameter.

parameters.name: tileWidth
parameters.help: The width of the tiles in the Tileset Image. If not given it will default to the map.tileWidth value, if that isn't set then 32.

parameters.name: tileHeight
parameters.help: The height of the tiles in the Tileset Image. If not given it will default to the map.tileHeight value, if that isn't set then 32.

parameters.name: tileMargin
parameters.help: The width of the tiles in the Tileset Image. If not given it will default to the map.tileWidth value.

parameters.name: tileSpacing
parameters.help: The height of the tiles in the Tileset Image. If not given it will default to the map.tileHeight value.

parameters.name: gid
parameters.help: If adding multiple tilesets to a blank/dynamic map, specify the starting GID the set will use here.

public.name: copy

returns.help: An array of the tiles that were copied.

public.help: Copies all of the tiles in the given rectangular block into the tilemap data buffer.

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: X position of the top left of the area to copy (given in tiles, not pixels)

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: Y position of the top left of the area to copy (given in tiles, not pixels)

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width of the area to copy (given in tiles, not pixels)

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height of the area to copy (given in tiles, not pixels)

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer to copy the tiles from.

public.name: create

returns.help: The TilemapLayer object. This is an extension of Phaser.Image and can be moved around the display list accordingly.

public.help: Creates an empty map of the given dimensions and one blank layer. If layers already exist they are erased.

parameters.name: name
parameters.help: The name of the default layer of the map.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width of the map in tiles.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height of the map in tiles.

parameters.name: tileWidth
parameters.help: The width of the tiles the map uses for calculations.

parameters.name: tileHeight
parameters.help: The height of the tiles the map uses for calculations.

parameters.name: group
parameters.help: Optional Group to add the layer to. If not specified it will be added to the World group.

public.name: createBlankLayer

returns.help: The TilemapLayer object. This is an extension of Phaser.Image and can be moved around the display list accordingly.

public.help: Creates a new and empty layer on this Tilemap. By default TilemapLayers are fixed to the camera.

parameters.name: name
parameters.help: The name of this layer. Must be unique within the map.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width of the layer in tiles.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height of the layer in tiles.

parameters.name: tileWidth
parameters.help: The width of the tiles the layer uses for calculations.

parameters.name: tileHeight
parameters.help: The height of the tiles the layer uses for calculations.

parameters.name: group
parameters.help: Optional Group to add the layer to. If not specified it will be added to the World group.

public.name: createFromObjects
public.help:
Creates a Sprite for every object matching the given gid in the map data. You can optionally specify the group that the Sprite will be created in. If none is
given it will be created in the World. All properties from the map data objectgroup are copied across to the Sprite, so you can use this as an easy way to
configure Sprite properties from within the map editor. For example giving an object a property of alpha: 0.5 in the map editor will duplicate that when the
Sprite is created. You could also give it a value like: body.velocity.x: 100 to set it moving automatically.

parameters.name: name
parameters.help: The name of the Object Group to create Sprites from.

parameters.name: gid
parameters.help: The layer array index value, or if a string is given the layer name within the map data.

parameters.name: key
parameters.help: The Game.cache key of the image that this Sprite will use.

parameters.name: frame
parameters.help: If the Sprite image contains multiple frames you can specify which one to use here.

parameters.name: exists
parameters.help: The default exists state of the Sprite.

parameters.name: autoCull
parameters.help: The default autoCull state of the Sprite. Sprites that are autoCulled are culled from the camera if out of its range.

parameters.name: group
parameters.help: Group to add the Sprite to. If not specified it will be added to the World group.

parameters.name: CustomClass
parameters.help: If you wish to create your own class, rather than Phaser.Sprite, pass the class here. Your class must extend Phaser.Sprite and have the same constructor parameters.

parameters.name: adjustY
parameters.help: By default the Tiled map editor uses a bottom-left coordinate system. Phaser uses top-left. So most objects will appear too low down. This parameter moves them up by their height.

public.name: createLayer

returns.help: The TilemapLayer object. This is an extension of Phaser.Sprite and can be moved around the display list accordingly.

public.help:
Creates a new TilemapLayer object. By default TilemapLayers are fixed to the camera.
The `layer` parameter is important. If you've created your map in Tiled then you can get this by looking in Tiled and looking at the Layer name.
Or you can open the JSON file it exports and look at the layers[].name value. Either way it must match.
If you wish to create a blank layer to put your own tiles on then see Tilemap.createBlankLayer.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer array index value, or if a string is given the layer name, within the map data that this TilemapLayer represents.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The rendered width of the layer, should never be wider than Game.width. If not given it will be set to Game.width.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The rendered height of the layer, should never be wider than Game.height. If not given it will be set to Game.height.

parameters.name: group
parameters.help: Optional Group to add the object to. If not specified it will be added to the World group.

public.name: destroy
public.help: Removes all layer data from this tile map and nulls the game reference.\nNote: You are responsible for destroying any TilemapLayer objects you generated yourself, as Tilemap doesn't keep a reference to them.

public.name: dump
public.help: Dumps the tilemap data out to the console.

public.name: fill
public.help: Fills the given area with the specified tile.

parameters.help: The index of the tile that the area will be filled with.

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: X position of the top left of the area to operate one, given in tiles, not pixels.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: Y position of the top left of the area to operate one, given in tiles, not pixels.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width in tiles of the area to operate on.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height in tiles of the area to operate on.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer to operate on.

public.help: For each tile in the given area defined by x/y and width/height run the given callback.

parameters.help: The callback. Each tile in the given area will be passed to this callback as the first and only parameter.

parameters.name: context
parameters.help: The context under which the callback should be run.

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: X position of the top left of the area to operate one, given in tiles, not pixels.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: Y position of the top left of the area to operate one, given in tiles, not pixels.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width in tiles of the area to operate on.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height in tiles of the area to operate on.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer to operate on.

public.name: replace
public.help: Scans the given area for tiles with an index matching `source` and updates their index to match `dest`.

parameters.name: source
parameters.help: The tile index value to scan for.

parameters.name: dest
parameters.help: The tile index value to replace found tiles with.

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: X position of the top left of the area to operate one, given in tiles, not pixels.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: Y position of the top left of the area to operate one, given in tiles, not pixels.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width in tiles of the area to operate on.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height in tiles of the area to operate on.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer to operate on.

public.name: searchTileIndex

returns.help: The first (or n skipped) tile with the matching index.

public.help:
Searches the entire map layer for the first tile matching the given index, then returns that Phaser.Tile object.
If no match is found it returns null.
The search starts from the top-left tile and continues horizontally until it hits the end of the row, then it drops down to the next column.
If the reverse boolean is true, it scans starting from the bottom-right corner travelling up to the top-left.

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The tile index value to search for.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.help: The number of times to skip a matching tile before returning.

parameters.name: reverse
parameters.help: If true it will scan the layer in reverse, starting at the bottom-right. Otherwise it scans from the top-left.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer to get the tile from.

public.name: setCollision
public.help: Sets collision the given tile or tiles. You can pass in either a single numeric index or an array of indexes: [ 2, 3, 15, 20].\nThe `collides` parameter controls if collision will be enabled (true) or disabled (false).

parameters.name: indexes
parameters.help: Either a single tile index, or an array of tile IDs to be checked for collision.

parameters.name: collides
parameters.help: If true it will enable collision. If false it will clear collision.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to this.currentLayer.

parameters.name: recalculate
parameters.help: Recalculates the tile faces after the update.

public.name: setCollisionBetween
public.help: Sets collision on a range of tiles where the tile IDs increment sequentially.\nCalling this with a start value of 10 and a stop value of 14 would set collision for tiles 10, 11, 12, 13 and 14.\nThe `collides` parameter controls if collision will be enabled (true) or disabled (false).

parameters.name: start
parameters.help: The first index of the tile to be set for collision.

parameters.name: stop
parameters.help: The last index of the tile to be set for collision.

parameters.name: collides
parameters.help: If true it will enable collision. If false it will clear collision.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to this.currentLayer.

parameters.name: recalculate
parameters.help: Recalculates the tile faces after the update.

public.name: setCollisionByExclusion
public.help: Sets collision on all tiles in the given layer, except for the IDs of those in the given array.\nThe `collides` parameter controls if collision will be enabled (true) or disabled (false).

parameters.name: indexes
parameters.help: An array of the tile IDs to not be counted for collision.

parameters.name: collides
parameters.help: If true it will enable collision. If false it will clear collision.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to this.currentLayer.

parameters.name: recalculate
parameters.help: Recalculates the tile faces after the update.

public.name: setLayer
public.help: Sets the current layer to the given index.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer to set as current.

public.name: setPreventRecalculate
public.help: Turn off/on the recalculation of faces for tile or collission updates.\nsetPreventRecalculate(true) puts recalculation on hold while\nsetPreventRecalculate(false) recalculates all the changed layers.

parameters.name: if
parameters.help: true it will put the recalculation on hold.

public.name: setTileIndexCallback
public.help: Sets a global collision callback for the given tile index within the layer. This will affect all tiles on this layer that have the same index.\nIf a callback is already set for the tile index it will be replaced. Set the callback to null to remove it.\nIf you want to set a callback for a tile at a specific location on the map then see setTileLocationCallback.

parameters.name: indexes
parameters.help: Either a single tile index, or an array of tile indexes to have a collision callback set for.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The callback that will be invoked when the tile is collided with.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context under which the callback is called.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to this.currentLayer.

public.name: setTileLocationCallback
public.help: Sets a global collision callback for the given map location within the layer. This will affect all tiles on this layer found in the given area.\nIf a callback is already set for the tile index it will be replaced. Set the callback to null to remove it.\nIf you want to set a callback for a tile at a specific location on the map then see setTileLocationCallback.

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: X position of the top left of the area to copy (given in tiles, not pixels)

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: Y position of the top left of the area to copy (given in tiles, not pixels)

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width of the area to copy (given in tiles, not pixels)

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height of the area to copy (given in tiles, not pixels)

parameters.name: callback
parameters.help: The callback that will be invoked when the tile is collided with.

parameters.name: callbackContext
parameters.help: The context under which the callback is called.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to this.currentLayer.

public.name: setTileSize
public.help: Sets the base tile size for the map.

parameters.name: tileWidth
parameters.help: The width of the tiles the map uses for calculations.

parameters.name: tileHeight
parameters.help: The height of the tiles the map uses for calculations.

public.name: shuffle
public.help: Shuffles a set of tiles in a given area. It will only randomise the tiles in that area, so if they're all the same nothing will appear to have changed!

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: X position of the top left of the area to operate one, given in tiles, not pixels.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: Y position of the top left of the area to operate one, given in tiles, not pixels.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width in tiles of the area to operate on.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height in tiles of the area to operate on.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer to operate on.

public.name: swap
public.help: Scans the given area for tiles with an index matching tileA and swaps them with tileB.

parameters.name: tileA
parameters.help: First tile index.

parameters.name: tileB
parameters.help: Second tile index.

parameters.name: x
parameters.help: X position of the top left of the area to operate one, given in tiles, not pixels.

parameters.name: y
parameters.help: Y position of the top left of the area to operate one, given in tiles, not pixels.

parameters.name: width
parameters.help: The width in tiles of the area to operate on.

parameters.name: height
parameters.help: The height in tiles of the area to operate on.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer to operate on.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The index of the TilemapLayer to operate on.

protected.name: getIndex

returns.help: The index of the element in the array, or null if not found.

protected.help: Gets the layer index based on the layers name.

parameters.name: location
parameters.help: The local array to search.

parameters.name: name
parameters.help: The name of the array element to get.

protected.name: getLayer
protected.help: Gets the TilemapLayer index as used in the setCollision calls.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to this.currentLayer.

protected.name: setCollisionByIndex
protected.help: Sets collision values on a tile in the set.\nYou shouldn't usually call this method directly, instead use setCollision, setCollisionBetween or setCollisionByExclusion.

parameters.name: index
parameters.help: The index of the tile on the layer.

parameters.name: collides
parameters.help: If true it will enable collision on the tile. If false it will clear collision values from the tile.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.help: The layer to operate on. If not given will default to this.currentLayer.

parameters.name: recalculate
parameters.help: Recalculates the tile faces after the update.

private.name: swapHandler
private.help: Internal function that handles the swapping of tiles.

public.name: collideIndexes
public.inlineHelp: An array of tile indexes that collide.

public.name: collision
public.inlineHelp: An array of collision data (polylines, etc).

public.name: currentLayer
public.inlineHelp: The current layer.

public.name: debugMap
public.inlineHelp: Map data used for debug values only.

public.name: format
public.inlineHelp: The format of the map data, either Phaser.Tilemap.CSV or Phaser.Tilemap.TILED_JSON.

public.name: game
public.inlineHelp: A reference to the currently running Game.

public.name: height
public.inlineHelp: The height of the map (in tiles).

public.name: heightInPixels
public.inlineHelp: The height of the map in pixels based on height * tileHeight.

public.name: images
public.inlineHelp: An array of Tiled Image Layers.

public.name: key
public.inlineHelp: The key of this map data in the Phaser.Cache.

public.name: layer
public.inlineHelp: The current layer object.

public.name: layers
public.inlineHelp: An array of Tilemap layer data.

public.name: objects
public.inlineHelp: An array of Tiled Object Layers.

public.name: orientation
public.inlineHelp: The orientation of the map data (as specified in Tiled), usually 'orthogonal'.

public.name: properties
public.inlineHelp: Map specific properties as specified in Tiled.

public.name: tileHeight
public.inlineHelp: The base height of the tiles in the map (in pixels).

public.name: tileWidth
public.inlineHelp: The base width of the tiles in the map (in pixels).

public.name: tiles
public.inlineHelp: The super array of Tiles.

public.name: tilesets
public.inlineHelp: An array of Tilesets.

public.name: version
public.inlineHelp: The version of the map data (as specified in Tiled, usually 1).

public.name: width
public.inlineHelp: The width of the map (in tiles).

public.name: widthInPixels
public.inlineHelp: The width of the map in pixels based on width * tileWidth.
